Courses.description: This course familiarizes 1st  year students with uses of Operating Systems. Linux is used as a platform for introducing Operating Systems concepts such as processes and files.
Courses.name: Operating Systems Usage

Courses.description: This course guides students in understanding the design and functioning of Computer Networks.
Courses.name: Computer Networks

Courses.description: This course supports students towards a more advanced understanding of Operating Systems.
Courses.name: Operating Systems

Courses.description: This course familiarizes students with Network Design concepts such as switching and routing.
Courses.name: Network Design

Courses.description: This course introduces students into the internal mechanics of Operating Systems.
Courses.name: Operating Systems Design

Courses.description: This course equips students with the concepts and techniques for conducting relevant performance evaluations and comparisons.
Courses.name: Performance Evaluation

Courses.description: Opportunities and challenges in designing mobile infrastructures
Courses.name: Mobile Systems

Courses.description: This course provides a set of tools for vulnerability assesment and security calibration, both at the network and at operating system levels.
Courses.name: Computer and Network Security

Courses.description: This course focuses on the planification, implementation and configuration of a secure, scalable, redundant and convergent network using dedicated firewalls and Unified Threat Management.
Courses.name: Dedicated Solutions for Network Security

Courses.description: How do you get from an idea to a sound engineering plan
Courses.name: Startup Engineering

Courses.description: The course covers topics in most popular wireless access methods today: WiFi and 3G/4G. These last hop networks are in every pocket today, but they don’t always deliver a seamless Internet experience.
Courses.name: Infrastructures and Services for Mobile Networks

Courses.description: This course presents the security architecture of mobile operating systems and describes attacks against mobile devices.
Courses.name: Mobile Security

Courses.description: How do you get from a sound engineering plan to a minimum viable product
Courses.name: Technical Entrepreneurship and Management

Courses.description: The course will address main concepts regarding the design of an audit for information system, starting from technical principles and current technologies, and then including considerations concerning ethical issues and legal concerns of implementation.
Courses.name: Auditing Network Security

Courses.description: The course presents a new approach of parallel and distributed system, which consists of a collection of interconnected stand-alone heterogeneous systems cooperatively working together as a single, integrated computing resource.
Courses.name: Cloud Security

Courses.description: How do you make you IT project a success
Courses.name: IT Project Management

Hitlist Announcements.text:
In 2020-2021 we have 203 students enrolled in PR. We will award 21 PR badges:
* 3 badges for midterm results
* 10 badges for lab activity
* 3 badges for final exam results
* 3 badges for lecture engagement
* 2 badges for comunity engagement

In 2020-2021 there are 462 students enrolled in RL. We will award 46 RL badges:
* 9 badges for midterm results
* 18 badges for lab activity
* 9 badges for hands-on exam 
* 9 badges for lecture engagement
* 1 community badges for digital engagement on cs.curs.pub.ro

In 2020-2021 we have 625 students enrolled in USO. We will award 61 USO badges:
* 12 badges for midterm results
* 23 badges for lab activity
* 10 badges for final exam results
* 10 badges for lecture engagement
* 5 community badges for digital engagement on cs.curs.pub.ro and Facebook

In 2019-2020 we have 135 students enrolled in PR. We will award 14 PR badges:
* 4 badges for midterm results
* 3 badges for lab activity
* 4 badges for final exam results
* 3 badges for lecture engagement

In 2019-2020 there are 462 students enrolled in RL. We will award 46 RL badges:
* 9 badges for midterm results

* 9 badges for hands-on exam 
* 9 badges for lecture engagement
* 1 community badges for digital engagement on cs.curs.pub.ro

In 2018-2019 there are 462 students enrolled in RL. We will award 46 RL badges:

* 9 badges for lecture engagement
* 1 community badges for digital engagement on cs.curs.pub.ro

In 2018-2019 we have 624 students enrolled in USO. We will award 60 USO badges:
* 12 badges for midterm results

* 10 badges for lecture engagement
* 5 community badges for digital engagement on cs.curs.pub.ro and Facebook

In 2017-2018 there will be awarded 59 USO badges:

* 4 community badges for digital engagement on cs.curs.pub.ro and Facebook
